summary: Animated text techniques that reinforce audio messages through dual coding and maintain visual stimulation through constant motion.

core_principles.description: Syncing text animations with spoken words increases comprehension by engaging visual and auditory processing simultaneously
Moving text prevents the eye from becoming dormant, keeping the visual cortex engaged
Text overlays should be brief, bold, and positioned to guide viewer attention
Display text at the speed of speech to lock viewer attention to the timeline
Position text to avoid UI elements on TikTok/YouTube interfaces

techniques.name: Alex Hormozi Style Captions
techniques.description: High-energy, colorful word-by-word captions with pop-ins, shakes, and emojis
implementation: Use bold sans-serif fonts (Montserrat Black, The Bold Font)
Apply high contrast colors: yellow (#FFFD03), neon green (#00FF00), cyan
Animate each word or 2-3 word phrase with pop-ins, shakes, or slides
Add emoji icons to replace abstract words (money = ðŸ’°
Keep captions near center of frame for visibility
Scale text dynamically based on emphasis
Add subtle rotation for key words
examples: Text: 'MAKE money' - pops in with shaking effect, green money emoji
Text: 'STOP watching' - red text shakes, stop sign icon appears
Text: 'RETENTION' - bold yellow slides from left with bounce
tools: Premiere Pro (manual keyframing for custom style)

pros_cons.pro: Gamifies listening, high engagement on mobile
pros_cons.con: Can feel exhausting or gimmicky if overused
Increases production time unless using AI tools

techniques.name: Karaoke Subtitles
techniques.description: Full sentence display where current word changes color or size as spoken, creating 'bouncing ball' rhythm
implementation: Display complete sentence on screen
Keyframe text fill or scale to change as words are spoken
Use different color for active word vs remaining words
Create smooth bounce or highlight effect on word change
Position at bottom center (below face if possible)
Use bold sans-serif fonts
Sync precisely with speaker's cadence
examples: Sentence: 'This changes everything' - words turn white â†’ gray â†’ white
Sentence: 'You need to watch this' - active word scales up 120%
Sentence: 'The result will shock you' - highlighter effect moves across sentence

pros_cons.pro: Guides viewer through sentence, reduces reading effort
pros_cons.con: Requires precise timing for best effect

pros_cons.pro: Holds viewer's hand through complex sentences
pros_cons.con: May appear as if viewer can't understand audio

techniques.name: Bold Text Overlays
techniques.description: Brief, punchy, all-caps text overlays for critical takeaways and chapter breaks
implementation: Keep word count minimal (2-7 words max)
Use bold, all-caps, high-contrast text
Position center frame for truth bombs, lower third for context
Add color backgrounds or outlines for contrast
Use for chapter titles, numbers, or key revelations
Apply simple pop-in or slide animations
Maintain visual hierarchy with different sizes/positions
examples: Center: 'STEP 1' - bold yellow, pops in with scale effect
Bottom: 'THE SECRET' - white with black outline, slides up
Center: 'RESULT: +300%' - large bold text, green background

pros_cons.pro: Creates visual structure and emphasis points
Ideal for structure and key takeaways
pros_cons.con: Less effective for continuous information flow

techniques.name: Interactive Text (Behind Objects)
techniques.description: Text that integrates with 3D space, appearing behind people or objects using masking/rotoscoping
implementation: Track footage with camera tracker
Create text layer in After Effects or compositor
Use rotoscoping or magic mask to create foreground mask
Position text behind foreground elements
Match depth of field with blur if needed
Use on shots where person moves or gestures
Create parallax effect by tracking camera movement
examples: Speaker gestures â†’ text appears and stays behind hand
Person walks â†’ reveals text from behind them
Product showcase â†’ text floats in 3D space around object
tools: After Effects (3D camera tracker, roto brush)

pros_cons.con: Significant time investment and skill required

techniques.name: Highlight and Extraction
techniques.description: Virtual highlighters and masking animations to guide attention to specific text or elements
implementation: Display document, article, or text on screen
Create shape layer for highlighter rectangle
Animate highlight following sentence being read
Use bright yellow, green, or pink for highlights
Add circle or box for key elements
Animate with smooth ease-in/out
Track camera movement if document moves
examples: Article â†’ yellow highlight bar slides across each sentence
List â†’ circles animate around bullet points as mentioned
Graph â†’ box highlights data section while discussed

pros_cons.pro: Prevents feeling overwhelmed by text walls
Directs viewer eye to important content
pros_cons.con: May feel over-produced for simple content

font.family: Montserrat Black, The Bold Font, Impact

hormozi_style_spec.emoji_rules: use for abstract concepts (money, time, success, danger)
